response.answer_text: I started my business in this space based on the troubles i faced doing distance education. Here are my findings. I would limit my discussions to the Employed person who is seeking a bachelors. The best online degree is the one which is highly suitable for an employed person should have Access to live classroom through online medium : The Student should be able to access live sessions or download these lectures at his leisure. The employed person cannot study on his own through books.Focus on learning and application instead of theory : The courseware should be designed to help him apply the knowledge he has gained.Accredition : The degree should be recognised by the governing body.Specialisation : There should be scope to specialise in the subject of his interest. I’m delighted that you’re looking at online learning as an option. At a time when everyone’s safety is the first priority, online education can get you an accredited degree from the comfort of your home in an affordable and flexible way. If you’re interested in a BBA or BCA, there are many options, and it can get confusing to decide. I would suggest that you check out Manipal Jaipur. It is the country’s first digital campus, it is UGC-recognised, and it has been awarded the Outstanding Contribution To Digital India Award by the Economics Times. If you enrol in the BBA program, you get key soft skills needed to succeed in the corporate world, hands-on training through projects and industry exposure and there’s even a special module on harnessing an entrepreneurial mindset. In the BCA course, you can be sure of cutting-edge training in the latest computer technology and software, and you can build critical soft skills. There are also modules on web design and development, multimedia and visual programming. You must have heard of Manipal already, and the good news is that the same excellence and attention is present in these online bachelor’s degrees. Do let me know how things work out for you.
